f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tackles the problem of a lack of a model ICT hub in the north East regional capital( Nalarigu). The proposal seeks to model a hub where the youth of the community and its neighbouring communities could have access to an ICT center and resources. The proposal points to a lack of an ICT center in this part of the region. There is little or no room for the teaming youth in the area to have access to basic ICT skills and resources. These opportunities for interested youths to learn modern trends with the use of ICT tools is lacking. This in turn provides opportunities for the teaming youth in this area of the country to gain training in ingormation and communication technology (ICT). Furthermore, this is in line with cardona's objectives of mass adoption of ICT in the Africa continent. The proposal provides key metrics and goals which align with the challenge settings. As such, an enhanced computer and internet literacy and the use of e-business in business- computer litercacy skills would be imparted. And also, better understanding of enterpreneurial activities would be conducted by the young men and women trained. The proposal presented addressess the programs goals and challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides information on what is necessary to its implementation. The proposals budget outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. The proposal provides evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement. The information shows the expertise of the team members with skills in ICT and blockchain. This will go a long way to educate the youth in this community and hence lead to the adoption of project catalyst. Also,the plan describes all the resources needed for implementation. The proposal seeks to acquire space for the development of a model ICT hub. This will serve the community within the short and long term of the proposal's plan. The proposal considers no risk and challenges from the onset and has clear measures in place to ensure the projects sustainability and implementation with the needed funding and supervision. Wada sees to the supervision of the said project. I believe if the budget receives the necessary funding can be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: There is clarity of information which provides step by step details on the key issues.The proposal provides clear understanable description of the targeted problems. The proposal provides the key metrics and KPI's that define the success of the proposal. This can be achieved if the hub is delivering according to the needs and opportunities of the community such as organizing of recurring events, education about project catalyst and blockchain technology education ( for all ages) and community out reach and events. Also, the model ICT hub is up and running under competent management and leadership. Furthermore, there would be practical innovations offered on tackling the unique challenges faced by the continent in this part of the region. I think the proposal provides sufficient information to assess the program in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: By establishing an ICT hub that would teach the youth of Naleriga fundamental ICT skills and how to use the cardano blockchain and its advantages, the plan aims to enhance the value of the cardano ecosystem. The initiative also aims to establish an ICT hub in Naleriga, the regional capital of the North East. Through the establishment of an ICT hub that would make use of the Cardano blockchain and ecosystem to provide chances for the young people in this region and Ghana as a whole, the project aims to boost the ICT literacy of youth in the north-eastern region of Ghana. With additional space to accommodate an expanding number of new participants, this project would serve as the foundation for the education of new Cardano contributors and developers.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a clearly defined timeline and plan, and it is anticipated to be completed within 4 to 8 months of receiving funding. The detailed budget for the project, which is projected to cost roughly $24,000 with the majority of the expense coming from equipment purchases, is also included in the proposal. The team members for this project are all qualified teachers and blockchain experts with the necessary experience to carry out the project more successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: According to the plan, members of the Wada faction of the Cardano ecosystem would be directly involved in monitoring and assisting with the implementation of the project, giving community members an easy way to audit and assess its progress. The proposal clearly outlined the milestones and key performance indicators, including; the increase in cardano awareness among young people in the north-eastern region, the high adoption of crypto, and the decrease in migration rates as a result of the absence of ICT centers in the area. The proposal also stated that there were no project-related risks, however the delivery deadlines for the project's various phases were not explicitly established.

solution: Set-up a premiere community hub in Nalerigu to offer students access to basic ICT training and services to compete with their peers in other regions and the globe at large.
experience: As a skilled IT professional, Lecturer and a blockchain educator over the past years I have educated over 500 young students in the area of cardano blockchain and the opportunities available through the support of Wada.
